bible.derived: Masoretic Text, Erasmus' third NT edition (1522), Martin Luther's 1522 German Bible.

translations.name: Tyndale Bible
translations.description: The Tyndale Bible is not a complete translation of the Bible, but rather a collection of William Tyndale’s translations completed prior to his execution, the New Testament and good portion of the Old Testament. Tyndale worked directly from Hebrew and Greek texts in his effort to make an easily read English Bible. His work was hugely influential to every major English translation of the Bible that followed.
